frameDefinitions: A Duty is imposed on a Responsible_party according to a Principle which regulates how the Responsible_party should respond to a Situation.

This frame covers a step in a criminal process in which a  Judge decides whether the Accused should be released on bail, and, if so, what the amount of the bail should be.  '' 'Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway, was granted $100,000 bail until June 18.'
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Responsible_party is required to perform some Duty.
The Authorities hold a Suspect under suspicion of having committed a crime (Charges).
During a court appearance, a Sentence, generally a punishment, is imposed on the Convict by a Court, usually represented by a judge.
frameExamples: They escaped total Soviet invasion and occupation only by entering into a separate agreement that <t>obligated</t> them to military action against the retreating German armies.
Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway, was granted $100,000 <t>bail</t> until June 18.
It is my <t>duty</t> to fight any attack on the Brotherhood .
The police <t>held</t> Mr. Smith in the slammer on charges of killing his lawyer.
The judge <t>sentenced</t> Martha Stewart to 2 years in prison for insider trading.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The <fen>Obligator</fen> is the person who imposes the <fen>Duty</fen> on the <fen>Responsible_party</fen>.
A state of affairs that results in the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> being obligated to carry out the <fen>Duty</fen> in accordance with the <fen>Principle</fen>.
A regulating idea  (which may be instantiated as a document)  that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is subject to.
The time interval during which  the <fen>Duty</fen> is imposed on the <fen>Responsible_party</fen>  by the <fen>Obligator</fen> or the <fen>Situation</fen>.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
At the time of bail setting, the <fen>Accused</fen> is held without bail/bond, released on his/her own recognizance, or required to give the Court  a specific amount of money for bail.
The <fen>Judge</fen>, as head of  the Court, determines the <fen>Accused</fen>'s bail.
<fen>Status</fen> idenitifies the decision made with regard to bail.  The possible statuses are 'without bail/bond', 'on one's own recognizance', or a specific amount of money required for bail.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the bail setting occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the bail setting occurs.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The time interval during which the Responsibly_party is obligated to fulfill the Duty.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
The <fen>Authorities</fen> hold the <fen>Suspect</fen> in custody.
This role identifies the person who is taken into custody and held, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
When the detaining occurs.
Where the detaining takes place.
The <fen>Convict</fen> is given a <fen>Sentence</fen> by the <fen>Court</fen>.
The <fen>Court</fen> imposes a <fen>Sentence</fen> on a <fen>Convict</fen>.
The <fen>Sentence</fen> is imposed on the <fen>Convict</fen> by the <fen>Court</fen>.
This role denotes the duration of the sentence.
The illegal action of which the <fen>Convict</fen> has been found guilty and for which they are punished.
The Time when the <fen>Convict</fen> is sentenced.
The location of the sentencing <fen>Court</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The winning bid committed <fex>her</fex> to paint an oil portrait for the high bidder.

Had she really said the word which pledged her <fex>to marry Horace Holmcroft in a
fortnight</fex>?
<fex>She</fex> pledged him to pay her the money back.
<fex>Admitting a genocide was occurring</fex>  would have obligated them, based on their signing the December 1948 Convention on the repression of genocide, to do something about it.
And <fex>no law</fex> obligated him to talk to the police, let alone the media

The City Council <fex>then</fex> obligated themselves to have the sewers made ready and the
streets leveled off without any additional cost to the Sisters.
<fex>At Dayton</fex>, the parties obligated themselves to respect and promote fulfillment of the annexes.
Judge Duncan fixed <fex>the doctor's</fex> bail at one million dollars.
<fex>Judge Duncan</fex> fixed the doctor's bail at one million dollars.
Judge Duncan fixed the doctor's bail <fex>at one million dollars</fex>.
<fex>Everyone</fex> has the obligation to vote.
My job is <fex>to get to the other side of the bridge</fex>.
<fex>At that time</fex> men were obligated to marry women from their own community.
I almost forgot to tell you that <fex>in Sweden</fex> we are obligated to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.
Judge Duncan sentenced <fex>Marty</fex> to five years under house detention.
<fex>Judge Duncan</fex> sentenced Marty to five years under house detention.
Judge Duncan sentenced Marty <fex>to five years under house detention</fex>.
Tom will recieve a <t>sentence</t> <fex>of five years</fex>.
A pet store owner was sentenced <fex>for illegaly smuggling protected reptiles</fex>.
He will be sentenced <fex>at a later date</fex>.
Biancaniello will be sentenced <fex>in San Francisco</fex> later this summer.
